thread.title: UAlbany men's basketball names team captains
thread.title_full: UAlbany men's basketball names team captains - Times Union

author: Tim Wilkin
title: UAlbany men's basketball names team captains
text:
Albany
University at Albany coach Will Brown announced Monday that seniors Peter Hooley , Ray Sanders and Reese Williams will serve as captains for the upcoming season.
Hooley is a three-time captain while Sanders and Williams will have the role for the first time.
"I am confident that they are ready to lead our basketball team on and off the court," Brown said. "We have high expectations for the 2015-16 season, and these three young men will provide the necessary direction for us to enjoy a successful season."
Hooley averaged 13.7 points per game last year and, along with Sanders and senior Evan Singletary , give Brown all of his starting backcourt from last year's team. The Danes won the America East Conference Tournament for the third straight time last year and went to the NCAA Tournament.
Hooley ranks eighth on the UAlbany Division I scoring list with 1,108 points.
Sanders played his first season with the Danes last year after transferring from Pensacola State Junior College . He was one of two returning Danes (Singletary was the other) to start in all 33 games last season when the Danes went 24-9. He averaged 9.7 points and 4.6 rebounds, the most of any returning player.
Williams is the first walk-on in Division I program history to be named a captain since the 2002-03 season when Brian Barnes , currently the head coach at Sage College , was given the title.
